A special NIA court acquitted all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case. The blast resulted in six deaths and numerous injuries. The court cited lack of evidence against Pragya Thakur. Investigations initially pointed to "saffron extremists". The case saw twists, including allegations against the NIA.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/malegaon-blast-case-sadhvi-pragya-says-she-was-tortured-to-name-pm-modi-forced-to-lie-about-yogi/articleshow/123060419.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/malegaon-blast-case-sadhvi-pragya-says-she-was-tortured-to-name-pm-modi-forced-to-lie-about-yogi/articleshow/123060419.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 15:46:40 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="51604" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123060579,imgsize-51604.cms"/></item><item><title>Prajwal Revanna gets life imprisonment for raping 47-year-old domestic worker</title><description><![CDATA[A special court in Bengaluru sentenced ex-MP Prajwal Revanna to life imprisonment on Saturday, following his conviction for the rape of a 47-year-old domestic worker. Revanna was found guilty of multiple offenses, including sexual harassment and voyeurism. He had fled to Germany after explicit videos surfaced but was arrested upon his return to India in May.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bengaluru/karnataka-sex-scandal-prajwal-revanna-gets-life-imprisonment-for-raping-47-year-old-domestic-worker/articleshow/123055698.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bengaluru/karnataka-sex-scandal-prajwal-revanna-gets-life-imprisonment-for-raping-47-year-old-domestic-worker/articleshow/123055698.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 16:20:53 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>RAJIV KALKOD</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="58790" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123055717,imgsize-58790.cms"/></item><item><title>Tejashwi targets EC with 'EPIC' barb over 'missing name'; poll panel, BJP hit back</title><description><![CDATA[Tejashwi Yadav ignited a political controversy by alleging his name was missing from Bihar's voter list, accusing the Election Commission of a conspiracy to manipulate voter rolls. He questioned the deletion of 65 lakh names and demanded transparency from the EC.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/bihar-sir-row-tejashwi-yadav-targets-ec-with-epic-barb-draws-bjps-ire/articleshow/123061575.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/bihar-sir-row-tejashwi-yadav-targets-ec-with-epic-barb-draws-bjps-ire/articleshow/123061575.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 17:03:18 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1035638" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123061530,imgsize-1035638.cms"/></item><item><title>Mid-air assault: IndiGo bars man who hit co-passenger; puts him on no-fly list</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/indigo-bars-man-who-hit-a-co-passenger-on-plane-flying-from-mumbai-to-kolkata-from-its-flights/articleshow/123062126.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/indigo-bars-man-who-hit-a-co-passenger-on-plane-flying-from-mumbai-to-kolkata-from-its-flights/articleshow/123062126.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 17:44:19 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SAURABH SINHA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="426342" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123062123,imgsize-426342.cms"/></item><item><title>Mark Zuckerberg meets 24-yr-old AI researcher who rejected Meta's $125m job offer</title><description><![CDATA[Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI dominance led them to recruit 24-year-old Matt Deitke, initially offering $125 million, which he declined. Zuckerberg's personal intervention resulted in a revised $250 million package, including potential $100 million in the first year. Deitke, known for his work on Molmo and founding Vercept, is a highly sought-after AI talent.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/mark-zuckerberg-meets-24-year-old-ai-researcher-who-rejected-metas-125-million-job-offer-and-then-/articleshow/123058105.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/mark-zuckerberg-meets-24-year-old-ai-researcher-who-rejected-metas-125-million-job-offer-and-then-/articleshow/123058105.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 12:36:30 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="23578" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123058081,imgsize-23578.cms"/></item><item><title>Pakistan: Shell blast kills 5 children, injures 12; sparks panic among residents</title><description><![CDATA[A devastating incident in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province resulted in the deaths of five children and injuries to twelve others when an old mortar shell exploded. The children discovered the unexploded shell in nearby hills and unknowingly brought it to their village, where it detonated while they were playing with it.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/pakistan/pakistan-shell-blast-kills-5-children-injures-12-sparks-panic-among-residents/articleshow/123062503.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/pakistan/pakistan-shell-blast-kills-5-children-injures-12-sparks-panic-among-residents/articleshow/123062503.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 18:19:58 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1119935" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123062581,imgsize-1119935.cms"/></item><item><title>IND vs ENG: Jaiswal, Crawley and Pope caught in fiery exchange - Watch</title><description><![CDATA[India dominated the morning session on Day 3 at The Oval, reaching 189 for 3 at lunch, fueled by Akash Deep's surprising 66 and Jaiswal's unbeaten 85. Tensions rose as Crawley and Pope confronted Jaiswal, seemingly frustrated by his perceived time-wasting. With a lead exceeding 100 and a flat pitch, India aims to capitalize on England's bowling shortage.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-yashasvi-jaiswal-zak-crawley-and-ollie-pope-caught-in-fiery-exchange-watch/articleshow/123062451.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-yashasvi-jaiswal-zak-crawley-and-ollie-pope-caught-in-fiery-exchange-watch/articleshow/123062451.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 18:12:08 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="117088" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123062480,imgsize-117088.cms"/></item><item><title>'Detonate atom bomb': Rajnath mocks, dares Rahul to share EC 'vote theft' proof</title><description><![CDATA[Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi's claim of possessing evidence of election malpractice in Bihar. Addressing a gathering in Patna, Singh urged Gandhi to reveal his so-called 'atom bomb' of evidence immediately. He also defended the Election Commission's integrity and highlighted Nitish Kumar's role in Bihar's transformation, contrasting it with Congress's past actions like the 1975 Emergency.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/rajnath-slams-rahuls-atom-bomb-claim-calls-past-allegations-damp-squib-defends-ecs-integrity/articleshow/123060364.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/rajnath-slams-rahuls-atom-bomb-claim-calls-past-allegations-damp-squib-defends-ecs-integrity/articleshow/123060364.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 15:33:30 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="645707" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123060454,imgsize-645707.cms"/></item><item><title>LinkedIn cofounder, Silicon Valley's biggest democrat supporter says: There's a problem with Blue states and…</title><description><![CDATA[Reid Hoffman admits that the Democratic Party alienated Silicon Valley. This drove tech leaders towards Donald Trump. He says attacks on cryptocurrency and Big Tech companies caused this shift. Hoffman points to California's regulations as a problem. He notes companies like Aurora Innovation tested in Texas due to better rules. He urges Democrats to adopt business-friendly policies.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/linkedin-founder-reid-hoffman-silicon-valleys-biggest-democrat-supporter-says-theres-a-problem-with-blue-states-and-they-need-to-/articleshow/123018971.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/linkedin-founder-reid-hoffman-silicon-valleys-biggest-democrat-supporter-says-theres-a-problem-with-blue-states-and-they-need-to-/articleshow/123018971.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 31 Jul 2025 16:21:55 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="40280" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123018898,imgsize-40280.cms"/></item><item><title>Watch | Gill, Gambhir's priceless reactions after Akash Deep's 50: 'Smile says it all'</title><description><![CDATA[Akash Deep's remarkable 66, achieved as nightwatchman, ignited celebrations in the Indian dressing room during the fifth Test. His partnership with Yashasvi Jaiswal surpassed a significant milestone, becoming the 18th century stand of the series. Gautam Gambhir and Shubman Gill's visible pride underscored the innings' impact, boosting India's lead and denting England's morale.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/smile-says-it-all-shubman-gill-gautam-gambhirs-priceless-reactions-after-akash-deeps-gritty-fifty-watch/articleshow/123062281.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/smile-says-it-all-shubman-gill-gautam-gambhirs-priceless-reactions-after-akash-deeps-gritty-fifty-watch/articleshow/123062281.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 18:00:00 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="46270" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123062318,imgsize-46270.cms"/></item><item><title>Nightwatchman Akash Deep breaks records; outshines Gautam Gambhir with fifty in England</title><description><![CDATA[Akash Deep's remarkable 66 as nightwatchman alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal's anchoring innings has solidified India's position in the fifth Test at The Oval. Their century partnership, a series highlight, surpassed a record set in 2003-04.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-nightwatchman-akash-deep-breaks-records-outshines-gautam-gambhir-with-fifty-in-england/articleshow/123061910.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-nightwatchman-akash-deep-breaks-records-outshines-gautam-gambhir-with-fifty-in-england/articleshow/123061910.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 17:29:57 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="95010" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123061938,imgsize-95010.cms"/></item><item><title>'Desh ka raja kaisa ho, Rahul jaisa ho' slogans at Cong event. Here's how he reacted</title><description><![CDATA[At a Congress Legal Conclave in Delhi, Rahul Gandhi rejected chants of him being the 'king' and launched a strong attack on the Election Commission of India. Gandhi alleged the 2024 Lok Sabha elections were rigged, claiming the electoral system is 'dead'.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/desh-ka-raja-kaisa-ho-rahul-gandhi-jaisa-ho-slogans-at-congress-conclave-heres-how-he-reacted-video/articleshow/123059542.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/desh-ka-raja-kaisa-ho-rahul-gandhi-jaisa-ho-slogans-at-congress-conclave-heres-how-he-reacted-video/articleshow/123059542.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 14:35:48 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="4992542" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123059615,imgsize-4992542.cms"/></item><item><title>Microsoft stops 30-year-old practice and drops Apple, IBM, Meta, Nvidia from its list of ...</title><description><![CDATA[Microsoft has stopped naming its competitors, such as Apple and Google, in its latest annual report, ending a nearly 30-year practice. The company now broadly describes the competitive landscape, citing the fast-moving nature of the markets. While executives still monitor rivals, this shift breaks from peers like Apple and Meta, who continue to name competitors.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/microsoft-makes-this-big-tradition-change-for-the-first-time-in-30-years-drops-google-apple-meta-from-the-list-of/articleshow/123029836.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/microsoft-makes-this-big-tradition-change-for-the-first-time-in-30-years-drops-google-apple-meta-from-the-list-of/articleshow/123029836.cms</guid><pubDate>Fri, 01 Aug 2025 11:09:22 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="82096" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123029832,imgsize-82096.cms"/></item><item><title>Spirit of cricket: Are India, England the worst-behaved teams in Test cricket?</title><description><![CDATA[The India vs England Test series has sparked debates over the spirit of cricket, with India accumulating more ICC demerit points. Sri Lanka statistically emerges as the worst-behaved team in the last two years, while England, Australia, and South Africa have the fewest demerit points. Despite recent tensions, England ranks among the best-behaved teams, and India sits in the middle.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/spirit-of-cricket-are-india-england-the-worst-behaved-teams-in-test-cricket/articleshow/123061439.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/spirit-of-cricket-are-india-england-the-worst-behaved-teams-in-test-cricket/articleshow/123061439.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 17:00:09 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="76740" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123061547,imgsize-76740.cms"/></item><item><title>Himachal may vanish into thin air if tourist inflows unchecked: SC</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/himachal-may-vanish-into-thin-air-if-tourist-inflows-unchecked-sc/articleshow/123051657.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/himachal-may-vanish-into-thin-air-if-tourist-inflows-unchecked-sc/articleshow/123051657.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 01:49:23 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="62378" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123051742,imgsize-62378.cms"/></item><item><title>Watch: Rohit Sharma arrives at The Oval as India make strong start on Day 3</title><description><![CDATA[Rohit Sharma, former India captain, was seen at The Oval on Day 3 of the crucial fifth Test, boosting fans' spirits. India started the day strong, with Akash Deep's surprising resilience and Yashasvi Jaiswal's continued form, reaching another half-century.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/watch-rohit-sharma-arrives-at-the-oval-as-india-make-strong-start-on-day-3-of-fifth-india-vs-england-test/articleshow/123061179.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/watch-rohit-sharma-arrives-at-the-oval-as-india-make-strong-start-on-day-3-of-fifth-india-vs-england-test/articleshow/123061179.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 16:37:59 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="995108" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123061390,imgsize-995108.cms"/></item><item><title>Shibu Soren critical: Former Jharkhand CM on ventilator in Delhi hospital</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/shibu-soren-critical-81-year-old-former-jharkhand-cm-on-ventilator-in-delhi-hospital-was-admitted-in-june/articleshow/123059806.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/shibu-soren-critical-81-year-old-former-jharkhand-cm-on-ventilator-in-delhi-hospital-was-admitted-in-june/articleshow/123059806.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 15:18:26 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="620997" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123060169,imgsize-620997.cms"/></item><item><title>'Stay out of the way': Shastri, Atherton slam Akash Deep's send-off to Duckett</title><description><![CDATA[During the fifth Test at The Oval, Indian pacer Akash Deep's demonstrative send-off to Ben Duckett sparked controversy. After dismissing Duckett, Akash Deep put his arm around the batter, prompting disapproval from commentators Michael Atherton and Ravi Shastri. They cautioned against physical contact, citing potential escalation and the importance of respecting boundaries in a non-contact sport.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-stay-out-of-the-way-ravi-shastri-mike-atherton-criticise-akash-deeps-send-off-to-ben-duckett/articleshow/123060449.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-5th-test-stay-out-of-the-way-ravi-shastri-mike-atherton-criticise-akash-deeps-send-off-to-ben-duckett/articleshow/123060449.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 15:40:38 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="41424" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123060547,imgsize-41424.cms"/></item><item><title>Nayara Energy hit by EU sanctions; looks at Indian oil companies to offload exports</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/russia-backed-nayara-energy-looks-at-indias-state-run-oil-companies-to-offload-petrol-diesel-exports/articleshow/123058165.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/russia-backed-nayara-energy-looks-at-indias-state-run-oil-companies-to-offload-petrol-diesel-exports/articleshow/123058165.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 15:30:53 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI BUSINESS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="121393" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123060366,imgsize-121393.cms"/></item><item><title>'Saiyaara' box office: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda’s film earns around Rs 3 cr on Saturday</title><description><![CDATA[Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara,' directed by Mohit Suri, continues its box office reign, nearing Rs 300 crore after 16 days. The film earned Rs 2.84 crore on Saturday, totaling Rs 287.84 crore. Despite new releases like 'Son of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2,' 'Saiyaara' maintains a strong performance, outperforming 'Dhadak 2' in early earnings.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/box-office/saiyaara-box-office-collection-day-16-live-ahaan-panday-and-aneet-paddas-film-continues-to-shine-outperforms-son-of-sardaar-2-and-dhadak-2-and-collects-around-rs-3-crore-on-saturday/articleshow/123061582.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/box-office/saiyaara-box-office-collection-day-16-live-ahaan-panday-and-aneet-paddas-film-continues-to-shine-outperforms-son-of-sardaar-2-and-dhadak-2-and-collects-around-rs-3-crore-on-saturday/articleshow/123061582.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 17:00:52 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="36268" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123061573,imgsize-36268.cms"/></item><item><title>'Gives bowlers no time to settle': Sidhu compares Jaiswal's impact to Sehwag</title><description><![CDATA[Navjot Singh Sidhu lauded Yashasvi Jaiswal, drawing parallels to Virender Sehwag's impactful opening style. Sidhu highlighted Jaiswal's aggressive yet composed approach after his quickfire fifty against England. He emphasised Jaiswal's ability to dominate bowlers and put his team in a winning position, praising his technical strengths and comparing his impact to Sehwag's after Sunil Gavaskar.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-gives-bowlers-no-time-to-settle-navjot-sidhu-compares-yashasvi-jaiswals-impact-to-virender-sehwag/articleshow/123061051.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-gives-bowlers-no-time-to-settle-navjot-sidhu-compares-yashasvi-jaiswals-impact-to-virender-sehwag/articleshow/123061051.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 16:20:56 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="37426" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123061082,imgsize-37426.cms"/></item><item><title>Uttarakhand: Landslide hits Vishnugad-Pipalkoti project site; 8 injured</title><description><![CDATA[A landslide at the Helang dam site of the Vishnugad-Pipalkoti hydropower project in Chamoli district injured eight workers on Saturday. Rescue teams swiftly responded, providing medical assistance and transporting the injured to various hospitals. While four are being treated at the THDC Hospital, others with more severe injuries have been referred to specialized medical facilities, with no fatalities reported.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/dehradun/8-injured-in-landslide-at-vishnugad-pipalkoti-project-site-in-uttarakhands-chamoli/articleshow/123059485.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/dehradun/8-injured-in-landslide-at-vishnugad-pipalkoti-project-site-in-uttarakhands-chamoli/articleshow/123059485.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 14:30:39 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SUKANTA MUKHERJEE</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="60288" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123059528,imgsize-60288.cms"/></item><item><title>'I love to play for the country' says Siraj on playing all five Tests vs England - Watch</title><description><![CDATA[Driven by passion, Mohammed Siraj embraces responsibility in the ongoing England series, dismissing concerns about physical strain. He took 4/86, matching Prasidh Krishna's figures, as India bowled England out for 247. Siraj's key wickets included Root and Brook. While acknowledging a potential 0.2% GDP impact, officials emphasize that cultural sensitivities and farmer welfare are paramount in upcoming talks with the US, scheduled to begin August 25.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/trade-war-tariffs-notified-government-hardens-its-position-on-no-go-areas/articleshow/123052301.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/trade-war-tariffs-notified-government-hardens-its-position-on-no-go-areas/articleshow/123052301.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 04:07:26 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1708832" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123057521,imgsize-1708832.cms"/></item><item><title>126 packages, six countries: Israel airdrops aid in Gaza</title><description><![CDATA[The IDF, in collaboration with six nations including Spain, France, and Germany, air-dropped humanitarian aid into Gaza, delivering 126 food packages. This initiative occurs amidst rising global criticism of the humanitarian crisis and accusations against Israel. Lt. Gen. Eyal Zamir refuted claims of starvation, blaming Hamas for the suffering and stating military operations will persist regardless of hostage negotiations.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/126-packages-six-countries-israel-airdrops-aid-in-gaza-dismisses-starving-palestinians-claims/articleshow/123056956.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/126-packages-six-countries-israel-airdrops-aid-in-gaza-dismisses-starving-palestinians-claims/articleshow/123056956.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 11:51:58 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="76378" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123057500,imgsize-76378.cms"/></item><item><title>Infra boost in Varanasi: PM Modi flags off Rs 2,200 crore projects</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/infra-boost-in-varanasi-pm-modi-flags-off-rs-2200-crore-projects-releases-20th-instalment-of-pm-kisan-scheme/articleshow/123056632.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/infra-boost-in-varanasi-pm-modi-flags-off-rs-2200-crore-projects-releases-20th-instalment-of-pm-kisan-scheme/articleshow/123056632.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 11:15:02 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="975792" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123056700,imgsize-975792.cms"/></item><item><title>‘Bumrah needs a proper off-season’: Australia cricket great McGrath</title><description><![CDATA[Glenn McGrath acknowledges Jasprit Bumrah's unique bowling style places extra stress on his body, leading to tough workload management decisions for India. McGrath emphasizes the need for Bumrah to play as much as possible due to his match-winning ability, but also highlights the importance of an off-season to prevent injuries.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/jasprit-bumrah-needs-a-proper-off-season-australia-cricket-great-glenn-mcgrath/articleshow/123057193.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/jasprit-bumrah-needs-a-proper-off-season-australia-cricket-great-glenn-mcgrath/articleshow/123057193.cms</guid><pubDate>Sat, 02 Aug 2025 11:47:54 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SHRIVATHSAN S</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="28452" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123057244,imgsize-28452.cms"/></item></channel></rss>

      <description><![CDATA[The Genius Act marks a turning point for stablecoins, offering them legal legitimacy and regulatory clarity. “This legitimisation of stablecoins is certainly going to give a huge boost,” says Eswar Prasad, Professor at Cornell University. With major players like Tether and USD Coin already surpassing $200 billion in market cap, the Act is expected to accelerate adoption and open doors for private issuers like Amazon and Walmart.]]></description>

      <description><![CDATA[SuperK plans to use its ₹100 crore Series B funding to deepen its presence in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Karnataka, rather than expanding nationwide. “We’re not trying to expand everywhere… the market we’re operating in already has immense depth,” said Neeraj Menta, Co-Founder of SuperK.     <item>
      <title><![CDATA[No interim US-India trade deal yet; Indian exporters brace for 20-25% tariffs as August 1 deadline nears]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/world/india-us-trade-deal-delay-trump-tariffs-impact-exporters-19644819.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Indian exporters are gearing up for possible US tariffs of 20–25% as the August 1 deadline set by President Trump approaches without an interim trade deal. While the tariff uncertainty has stalled orders, industry leaders say Indian exporters remain competitively placed compared to rivals like Bangladesh and China. Exporters expect the tariffs to impact profit margins more than supply chains, with fresh orders likely once clarity emerges post-deadline. Trade talks are set to resume in August as both countries work toward a broader agreement.]]></description>
      <pubDate><![CDATA[Mon, 28 Jul 2025 23:11:22 +0530]]></pubDate>

      <description><![CDATA[Rainbow Children’s Medicare is maintaining its FY26 revenue growth guidance of 18–20% despite a seasonal dip in occupancy. CMD Dr. Ramesh Kancharla said the company remains optimistic as demand picks up in the coming quarters. While surgical revenue rose 15%, margins are expected to moderate to 24–25% (pre-Ind AS) due to new hospital additions. Average revenue per patient is projected to grow 6% year-on-year.]]></description>
